intro: Cupaniopsis megalocarpa, commonly known as the giant cupaniopsis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
